etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "wood") + phonetic: 𣬉 (zhā) = tree with phonetic association -> "hawthorn"
etymology.interpretation: The character 楂(楂) (zhā, "hawthorn") combines 木(木) (mù, 'wood'), indicating it's a type of tree, with the component 𣬉 (zhā) to give the sound. This effectively conveys the phonetic and semantic qualities associated with a hawthorn tree.

examples.chinese: 我爱吃楂(我愛吃楂)，这种果实很甜(這種果實很甜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ ài chī zhā, zhè zhǒng guǒshí hěn tián.
examples.english: I love eating hawthorn; this fruit is very sweet.

examples.chinese: 厨师用楂制作酱料(廚師用楂製作醬料)，佐餐效果特别好(佐餐效果特別好)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī yòng zhā zhìzuò jiàngliào, zuǒcān xiàoguǒ tèbié hǎo.
examples.english: The chef uses hawthorn to make a sauce, and it pairs especially well with meals.
